{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3306162,"name":"Carl Schultz","username":"HubbaBubbaBubbleTape","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/c6cbf5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-10T02:50:46.841Z","cooked":"

I had some questions about the encoders for the swerve drive mk4 modules. So we are trying to save some slots on the PDP and I have been seeing that you can wire the power cables together into one, so my question is can I do that and how do I wire them into one? Again any help is appreciated and I will give any additional information needed.

(Below are attached pictures of the swerve drive if you are confused about which encoders I am talking about)

image1200×1200 69.4 KB

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-02-10T05:08:23.776Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":44,"readers_count":43,"score":8.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":454133,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-encoder-questions","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":14984,"username":"Christopher149","name":"Christopher149","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/838e76/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51887,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"YAGSL & YASS Creator "},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-encoder-questions/454133/3","custom_user_title":"YAGSL & YASS Creator ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3306382,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-10T16:53:03.754Z","cooked":"

You are likely using CANcoders. You can just run all the power wires back to one point (probably near the PH/PDH) and solder/heat shrink them into a single pair of wires to connect into the power distribution. You can also use something like the mini power module if you like.

You will need to use a fuse/breaker sized for the smallest wire in your circuit – this should be the wire to the CANcoders. If you have CANcoders that came pre-wired, this is 22 AWG, which means either a 5A or 10A fuse or a 10A breaker. If you are using the REV PH, use one of the smaller power outputs (20-23) and a fuse, to save the higher current outputs for other uses.
